note.text: Traditional Afghan dress is still common. Men wear long, baggy pants and a long shirt called a “perahan tunbaan” topped with a vest called a “waskat.”

Women are no longer required by law to wear a burqa in public, though in practice many women are still expected to, especially after they are married. Other types of veils or headscarves, called “hijabs,” are gaining popularity. In addition to the veil, women wear a top called a “firaq” with a skirt, called a “partug,” or a long dress, called an “abaya.”
